channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2023070817
item.description:
Report X-2023070817

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: JOHNSTOWN
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023070817 SequenceEvent: The package was found on its side inside van. The outside of box appeared wet. Package was placed upright in hazmat tote. DescribePack: It appears to have leaked from the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed upright in hazmat tote and moved to hazmat cage under vent. 2. X-2023070819 SequenceEvent: The package was found on its side inside van. The outside of box appeared wet. Package was placed upright in hazmat tote. DescribePack: It appears to have leaked from the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed upright in hazmat tote and moved to hazmat cage under vent.

item.title: Report X-2023070770
item.description:
Report X-2023070770

  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: An Ops Manager radioed that a damaged hazmat was discovered in the Unload. I brought PPE to clean up and contain the package and spillage. DescribePack: The packaging of the contents had very visible wet marks that spanned roughly half of the total surface area of the box. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Quick responsiveness

  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was brought to QA area inside a tote to contain leaking. the small cap was loose and contents was leaking from jerrican. damaged hazmat process was started. DescribePack: the small cap was loose and contents was leaking from jerrican DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was placed inside of a tote to contain liquid and soaker pads were used to soak up loose liquid.

item.title: Report X-2023070738
item.description:
Report X-2023070738

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found in the load side wet, upon inspection contents were found having a loosed cap and about 1 liter having leaked out. Leak was mainly contained to box, remaining contents absorbed with absorbent pads. Package was loaded into a damage tote lined with plastic bag. DescribePack: Cap was loosened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed on top of absorbent pads, though most was contained to outer box.

item.title: Report X-2023070693
item.description:
Report X-2023070693

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-02
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found leaking in the unload, it was brought to QA in a salvage drum with liner. Leak was contained to package at first, orientation arrows were not followed, so all contents of one container were allowed to leak out. DescribePack: One lid of two were found detached from bottle, it is unclear how this happened, as cap is not threaded, nor were there any signs of dents or compression on the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was brought to QA in a damage tote with liner. Once brought to QA, the undamaged bottle was placed upright.

item.title: Report E-2023070533
item.description:
Report E-2023070533

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-30
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 30, 2023, sixteen (16) one-gallon paint pails were damaged during transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works Inc (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. EWI personnel deployed granular absorbents to the ink-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All damaged pails and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums to be staged onsite for disposal by R+L. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2023070435

Report E-2023070435

  • City: HENDERSON

  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that there was a leak in one case of vapocide (un3017) and that one of the inner poly 2.5 gallon jug had a defective lid and that 4 ounces had been released. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070402
item.description:
Report E-2023070402

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that 2 cases of hair clog remover (un1824) had been damaged by a sharp object and that 5 of the inner poly 1 liter bottles had released 5 liters of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the 200 pound poly super sack of cupric sulfate (un3077) releasing 1 pound of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
